page.title: 15GOLDHANGER - HEAD STREET
page.content: We do not know why it is called Head Street,but I think it is because when the ploughs turned round at the head of the field a strip of land was left,which became a pathway.On the left of the road there is a bus shelter which is in memory of King Goerge VI and built about 1960. On the other side there is similar bus shelter. On the right there is a house called"Wheelwrights" which used to be the site of a wheel maker. Further up there is a builders house, it is called Sunnyside house.The first house on the right used to be a post office and shop but now it is a private house. One knows it was a shop because the window is big and oblong like a toy shop window.In Head street there is a half timbered house.It has a white door and typical black beams on the front,with plaster fillings.
